evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.misc
Class SegmentedLine

java.lang.Object
  evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.misc.SegmentedLine

public class SegmentedLine
extends java.lang.Object

==================================
The SegmentedLine Class.
==================================

This class takes a line of text that contains words separated by known characters and extracts all of the words. The characters that are treated as separators are passed into the constructor. It also allows the user to specify if he or she would like for two consecutive separators to be treated as one separator, or to mark an empty word.

Within the constructors, the mode specifies whether or not to treat two consecutive separators as defining an "empty" token (MODE_ALLOW_EMPTY_SEGS), or treat two consecutive separators as one separator (MODE_NO_EMPTY_SEGS). The default in the constructors that do not contain a passed in mode parameter is the first: MODE_ALLOW_EMPTY_SEGS.

The method that segments a line is segmentTheLine(String).

It is also possible to segment the line based on set indices within the line. The constructor that accomplishes this is the SegmentedLine(String, int[]) constructor. The method that is used to segment the line segmentTheLineByFixedWidth(String).

The method reconstructLine(...) can be used to build a String corresponding to the segments of the current SegmentLine object, with separators being specified by the first parameter. The second parameter specifies if the individual elements of the output are to be quoted (useful for building database queries).

To navigate the segments found, use the methods getNumberOfSegments() within a for loop and getASegment(int) to acquire each segment. Or you can use the getNextSegment() method in a while loop, quitting when null is returned. In this case, call resetPtr() to reset to the first segment.

SegmentedLine

public SegmentedLine(java.lang.String line,
                     int[] positions)
Segment the line based on indices of characters with the line. The positions array specifies the indices as the first index of each new segment. For each position which is beyond the length of the String, a segment of "" is assumed. Otherwise it is just the substring from the indexed character to the character immediately before the next indexed character. The positions must be non-negative and in increasing order!

Parameters:
line -
positions - The positions; all non-negative and in increasing order.
Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize(java.lang.String line,
                       java.lang.String separators,
                       boolean mode,
                       int[] positions)
This does basic initialization for SegmentedLine. If positions is NOT null, then the line will be segmented based on positions (see the constructor above). Otherwise it will be segmented based on the separators.

Parameters:
line -
separators - Collection of characters each of which is a separator.
mode - Either MODE_ALLOW_EMPTY_SEGS or MODE_NO_EMPTY_SEGS.
positions - The positions; all non-negative and in increasing order.

reconstructLine

public java.lang.String reconstructLine(java.lang.String separator,
                                        boolean quoteelements)
Reconstruct the segmented line with one specific separator between segments. If quoteelements is true, then each element should be in separate quotes after reconstruction.

Parameters:
separator - The separator(s) used in the reconstructed line.
quoteelements - If true, the line will have each segment in double quotes.
Returns:
segmented line

reconstructLine

public java.lang.String reconstructLine(java.lang.String separator,
                                        boolean quoteelements,
                                        boolean singlequotes)
Reconstruct the segmented line with one specific separator between segments. If quoteelements is true, then each element should be in separate quotes after reconstruction.

Parameters:
separator - The separator(s) used in the reconstructed line.
quoteelements - If true, the line will have each segment in quotes.
singlequotes - If true, the line will use single quotes. Otherwise it will use double quotes.
Returns:
segmented line

removeRepeats

public void removeRepeats(boolean ignorecase)
Removes any repeat segments. This will result in a group of segments each of which is unique.

Parameters:
ignorecase - If true, case will be ignored in comparing segments.

removeSegment

public void removeSegment(int index)
Removes the segment at the specified index. If the index is invalid, nothing happens.
